children.value: We recommend setting up PWA, which

A Progressive Web App (PWA) is a web app that uses modern web capabilities 
to deliver an app-like experience to users. These apps meet certain requirements
(see below), are deployed to servers, accessible through URLs, and indexed 
by search engines (optionally).
To be considered a Progressive Web App, BooGi-based pages:
- Work for every user, regardless of browser choice.

- Fit any form factor, desktop, mobile, tablet, or whatever is next.
(improvements in responsiveness are coming soon..)

- Enhanced with service workers to work offline or on
low quality networks.

- Use the app-shell model to provide app-style navigation and
interactions.
- Always up-to-date thanks to the service worker update process.

- Served via HTTPS to prevent snooping and ensure content has not been
tampered with. (depends on deployment option of your choice)

- Are identifiable as “applications” thanks to W3C manifests
and service worker registration scope allowing search engines to find them.
- Make re-engagement easy through features like push notifications.

- Allow users to “keep” apps they find most useful on their
home screen without the hassle of an app store.
- Meaning they’re zero-friction, zero-install, and easy to share.
In order for PWA to work properly, following base properties

.
Additional properties used, when provided, are:
if you want to enable PWA.
Customize what browser UI is shown when your app is launched. For example, you can hide the address bar and browser chrome.
to enable sharing resources via cookies. Any invalid keyword or empty string will fallback to
You can find more information about crossorigin on
Path to icon the app should use and generate icons of other resolution based on it. It must exist in
List of icons the app should use. Example:
must be set. Read more about icons in
Path to specific icon the app should use.
A string containing space-separated image dimensions used as app icons. Examples:
It is automatically calculated, so override it with caution
There are three modes in which icon generation can function:

- Generate a pre-configured set of icons from a single source icon.
Used when only

- Generate a manually configured set of icons from a single source icon.
Used when both

- Don’t generate or pre-configure any icons. 
Used when only
If favicon is missing and not defined in

, it also will be created
in automatic or hybrid modes.
For best results, if you’re providing an icon for generation it should be:
at least as big as the largest icon being generated (512x512 by default).
square (if it’s not, transparent bars will automatically be added to make it square).
of one of the following formats: JPEG, PNG, WebP, TIFF, GIF or SVG.
Below is a set of allowed properties of
Opens the web application without any browser UI and takes up the entirety of the available display area.
Opens the web app to look and feel like a standalone native app. The app runs in its own window, separate from the browser, and hides standard browser UI elements like the URL bar.
, but provides the user a minimal set of UI elements for controlling navigation (such as back and reload).

metadata:
  name: My Awesome BooGi site
  siteImage: /assets/myapp.png
  pathPrefix: /
  theme_color: '#0066cc'
pwa:
  enabled: true

metadata:
  name: My Awesome BooGi site
  short_name: BooPWA
  description: This is my PWA-enabled BooGi site
  language: en
  pathPrefix: /
  theme_color: '#0066cc'
pwa:
  enabled: true
  manifest:
    display: standalone
    crossOrigin: use-credentials
    icon: "/assets/mycustomicon.png"
    icons:
      - src: /assets/pwa-320.png
        sizes: 320x320
